pros: worked with my school schedule

pros: Pay is good, some benefits available if you're willing to hunt them down coworkers willing to help and try their best to guide.
cons: No training/standards Management constantly talking down to employees and spreading gossip They won't consult you about your schedule changing, will just put you on whenever they need you, not post the schedule until the morning of the new week, and then penalize people for not showing up for shifts they weren't aware of.

pros: Small school in a rural setting with nice buildings and facilities.
cons: EXTREME pandering of students - to the point where students may pass some courses without ever attending or participating!

review_title: Incredible place to teach and work
pros: Nichols has gotten so much better in the past year, and keeps getting better. New administration, new faculty, new staff and coaches, and all keeps getting better and better. Students are a true delight here. I have taught at other colleges, and this is the best.
cons: Need to update some of the older buildings

review_title: Egotistical Leadership Will Ruin This Place Within 5 Years
pros:
-I met some great people, who I will keep in touch with for years to come. 
-Fridays off in the summer. 
-Was once a stable job (until a change in leadership) 
-Some students were really eager to learn, even from employees in their positions, and brought great energy to the campus.
-I loved the chance to help lower-income students that were there on scholarships.
cons: Has anyone calculated the turnover rate of employees in the past year? Or would that look too much like they actually care who comes & goes? The way this institution is run is, unfortunately, a huge joke. For a college being run by a man who cares deeply about a macho image, it's incredibly ironic how sensitive he is. I've heard dozens of interactions where employees are yelled at, criticized, and scared to lose their jobs all because the President has a hurt ego. He may be great with students, but they're not seeing the behind-the-scenes of the bow tie. For a student body that advocates well for themselves to promote LGBTQIA+, BLM, diversity, etc., you would think they'd want a president that supports the same causes? As a whole, the entire upper administration has unrealistic expectations for a failing college with overworked, underpaid, and mistreated employees. Employee appreciation days twice a year are not enough to make up for being intimidated and scared to lose my job on a daily basis. If you're looking for people that will work 55+ hour work weeks, then you have to compensate them and provide them opportunities for growth. And if they stop hiring only Nichols graduates (not a great look for alumni career outlook btw), a lot fewer people would accept their low-ball job offers at a toxic workplace. The way people are treated is disrespectful and often misogynistic, which should not be a huge surprise. I could go on, but given the current track of the school, it won't even be around in a couple of years to criticize :/ The college has really great potential to help lower-income scholarship students, commuter students, and first-gen students get a solid business degree. But it's becoming clear that shiny new buildings and creating a vineyard-vines-looking campus is a bigger priority than retaining talent to build a brighter future.

pros: Flexible scheduling of courses, high level of technology available in classrooms.
cons:
The pay is awful. The last time the college increased salaries for adjuncts was 2011. They only pay $3300 per class. 

Also, they do not notify you personally if not renewed.

job_title: Vice President in Virginia Beach, VA
pros:
Team driven culture that thrives on helping students matriculate and then get good jobs upon graduation.  
Above average benefit package for an institution of this size.
Salary reviews are based on performance.  Staff who perform do well and stay at the college for many years.  
A beautiful New England campus makes for a great work environment. Buildings and Grounds has done a fabulous job of beautifying campus and the board of trustees has raised money to add new modern buildings that remain faithful to the traditional look and feel.
cons: Because many staff tend to stay at the college for careers there is not as much upward mobility for people in a hurry to get ahead.

job_title: Adjunct Graduate Professor in Dudley, MA
pros: Sense of community and shared purpose.  Forward thinking graduate school.  Opportunity to be heard and make a difference.  Fun, supportive environment to work in and be a part of...  Interesting courses to teach.  Terrific students!
cons: Pay is lower for adjunct professors than similar caliber local business schools.  High expectations from the Graduate & Professional Studies department to give above and beyond (committees, retreats, professional development, curriculum review/revisions, etc.).

pros: Nichols College gives a sense of belonging and has strong community values. There is always an air of the utmost professionalism.
cons: Upward mobility seems to be limited.

review_title: Great experience with a great culture.
pros: College Culture, College Values, Hours (especially during the summer), Good work/life balance, Community involvement, Friendly/helpful coworkers, Updating campus to more modern facilities to benefit staff and students
cons: There are not many cons to working here, if you love the education atmosphere and being a part of student success. If you are interested in advancement and promotions, this is not the place for you.

review_title: Assistant to the Sports Management Chair
pros: Very flexible hours, and reasonable deadlines to meet.
cons: Many hours constructing excel spreadsheets. Occasionally there is limited space to conduct the work at this present time.

pros: Flexible working environment and beautiful campus. Super responsive IT department support.
cons: They take advantage of the most conscientious workers without providing adequate support, sufficient resources, and an honest appraisal of work load.

pros: Beautiful community; people are nice
